definition: like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods
bee/wasp

sentences.english: Farmers didn't have to scrambled to plant common vegetables this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年農民不再一窩蜂似的種大路菜了。

sentences.english: Uber-rich Mainland Chinese business owners have been flocking to Hong Kong, and it's not just because it's the world's business and trade center.
sentences.chinese: 中國內地的鉅富們正在一窩蜂地擁向香港。

sentences.english: People rushed into the bus when it came.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽車到站時，人們都一窩蜂地往上擠。

sentences.english: When public figures die we mourn them en-masse.
sentences.chinese: 每當有公衆人物去世，我們總是一窩蜂地進行哀悼。

sentences.english: They attacked the circus like a hive of bees and arrested all involved.
sentences.chinese: 於是一窩蜂似地突襲了馬戲團，逮捕了所有涉案人員。

sentences.english: The ferrets rush wildly for the fireplace.
sentences.chinese: 小鼬子一窩蜂似地跑向壁爐。

definition: striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
one falls, the next follows (idiom); stepping into the breach to replace fallen comrades/advancing wave upon wave
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
desolate and uninhabited (idiom)
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
resolute/definitive/categorically/absolutely
to remain unmoved
to show off one's military strength (idiom); to strut around/to bluff/to bluster
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
lit. to see a gap and stick in a needle (idiom); fig. to make use of every second and every inch
to strut/swaggering
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
